channel.title: Dummie
channel.description: does anybody know how to make a dummy when i hit it give me skill xp?

item.title: Dummie
item.dc:creator: @Bacus23 Bacus23
item.description:
@Bacus23 wrote:

so exactly where do i add that?

Read full topic

item.title: Dummie
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Oh, I’m fine, thanks.
You probably have a switch statement for packetType somewhere.
You’d put

case 523:
sendMessage(“You train Def !”);
setAnimation(1978);
addSkillXP((5000*playerLevel[1]), 1);
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
break;

under it.
If it gives you a duplicate case error, you already have a case for 523.

Read full topic

item.title: Dummie
item.dc:creator: @Bacus23 Bacus23
item.description:
@Bacus23 wrote:

[quote=“Keasho, post:3, topic:178916”]look up the dummies object ID in java.client or a word in the phrase it says when u click on it…

if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You train Def !"); actionTimer = 53; setAnimation(1978); addSkillXP((5000*playerLevel[1]), 1); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

The number which is 5000 ^ change that to what ever number u want, save and compile and it should work[/quote]

where do i add that?

and hey qwerty hows it going?

Read full topic

item.title: Dummie
item.dc:creator: @Keasho Keasho
item.description:
@Keasho wrote:

look up the dummies object ID in java.client or a word in the phrase it says when u click on it…

if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You train Def !"); actionTimer = 53; setAnimation(1978); addSkillXP((5000*playerLevel[1]), 1); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

The number which is 5000 ^ change that to what ever number u want, save and compile and it should work
